p: It should be noted that the search for new formulations has also led to patenting. For example, patent BR1020180168665 describes the preparation and characterization of nanostructured lipid carriers (NLCs) and nanoemulsions containing citronella and neem oil, for the control of insects such as Aedes aegypti. The results showed that both the nanoemulsions and the NLCs loaded with the essential oils caused 100% mortality of A. aegypti larvae during the first day of exposure, while the NLCs without essential oil induced 100% mortality after 10 days of exposure. Both carriers showed satisfactory efficacy in the control of A. aegypti larvae (Fraceto et al., 2018).
